result.execSummary:
The defendant David W Cook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: Fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week.

Absolute sobriety except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with advanced written authorization of agent.
No possession of dangerous weapons.
No contact with D.T., Mountain Lanes, J.B., or CoVantage Credit Union.

SAFE program or equivalent.
Mental health assessment.
DNA sample on Felony.
All written orders for restitution to be paid out of 25% of prison wages and remainder to be paid as part of ES.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Deft makes statement. 
State objects to petition. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT denies petition for sentence adjustment.

ADDRESS INFO for David W Cook
Current: 2909 E Park Ave, c/o Chippewa Valley Corr Treatment Fac, Chippewa Falls, WI 54729 United States  (Effective: 04-20-2016)
Prior: 500 Forest Street, Wausau, WI 54403
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 4:27 pm 
INCLUDES 14CF621, 14CF705, 14CF854, 14CM1151, 15CF132, AND 15CF133. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty John Bachman.  
State recites agreeement of the parties. Atty Bachman makes statement - deft contests abitilty to pay restitution. COURT holds ability to pay issue in abeyance until deft is released on extended supervision. 

WAIVER OF PRELIMINARY HEARINGS IN 14CF621, 14CF854, 15CF132, AND 15CF133. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed. 
Court questions deft as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Informations filed. 

PLEA HEARING IN ALL FILES. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 14CF621: Ct. 2 (DC/Use of Dangerous Weapon/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 14CF705: Ct. 1 (Burglary/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 14CF854: Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 14CM1151: Ct. 1 (Battery/DA/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                       : Ct. 2 (DC/Repeater/DA)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF132: Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF133: Ct. 2 (Issue of Worthless Checks/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 14CF621: Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 14CF705: Ct. 2 (Theft/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 14CF854: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Obstructing an Officer/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CF132: Ct. 1 (Forgery-Uttering/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CF133: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 14CF621: Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater)>>2 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 1 year ES - to run concurrent to all other sentences. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>2 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 1 year ES -  to run concurrent to all other sentences. 
In 14CF705: Ct. 2 (Theft/Repeater)>>2 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 1 year ES - to run concurrent to all other sentences. 
In 14CF854: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>6 years imprisonment - 3 years IC and 3 year ES -  to run concurrent to all other sentences. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Obstructing an Officer/Repeater)>>2 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 1 year ES - to run concurrent to all other sentences. 
In 15CF132: Ct. 1 (Forgery-Uttering/Repeater)>>6 years imprisonment - 3 years IC and 3 years ES - to run concurrent to all other sentences. 
In 15CF133: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>6 years imprisonment - 3 years IC and 3 years ES - to run concurrent to all other sentences. 

COURT ORDERS as conditions of ES in all>>SAFE program or equivalent; mental health assessment; AODA; absolute sobriety except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with advanced written authorization of agent; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week; no possession of any dangerous weapons; restitution as reflected in written orders to be paid out of 25% of prison wages and remainder to be paid as part of ES; no contact with D.T., Mountain Lanes, J.B., or CoVantage Credit Union; DNA sample on felony; payment of court costs. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 231 days sentence credit in 14CF621 and 14CF705, 192 days sentence credit in 14CF854, and 57 days sentence credit in 15CF132 and 15CF133. 
COURT finds the def is NOT eligible for CIP and IS eligible for SAP. 
COURT remands def to the custody of the sheriff's dept for transport to WI State prison system. 

Adj: 5:08 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 18, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on April 9, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

INCLUDES 14CF621, 14CF705, 14CF854, 14CM1151, 15CF133 and 15CF132.   No contact with victim(s): J.B., D.T., & Mt. Lanes.  No contact with Co-Vantage (Wausau) and Connexus (Wausau).  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. 14CM1151 Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.
